article_title: New Report Shows The U.S. Is Heading For A Fiscal Danger Zone

article_metadata.description: As you consider the lavish promises of various presidential candidates, here’s a bit of useful context: Even without the effects of promised tax cuts or new spending, the long-term fiscal outlook is grim. Federal debt held by the public will rise rapidly from 75.6 percent of Gross Domestic Product today to 91 percent by 2025 and 152 percent by 2040, according to a new forecast.
article_metadata.author: Business in the Beltway
